abstract: Under an offer from the district attorney's office, some 300 Occupy Wall Street protesters could have charges against them dismissed as long as they do not get arrested again in the next six months.
snippet: Under an offer from the district attorney's office, some 300 Occupy Wall Street protesters could have charges against them dismissed as long as they do not get arrested again in the next six months.
lead_paragraph: The Manhattan district attorney's office will not summarily dismiss the charges against some 300 Occupy Wall Street protesters who were arrested and charged with disorderly conduct during rallies on the Brooklyn Bridge and at Union Square, a lawyer for the protesters said Monday.

headline.main: District Attorney Won't Drop Charges Against Protesters
